articles.title: 26th ITCN Asia to be held in Lahore on May 9
articles.summary: 26th edition of ITCN Asia, Pakistan's biggest IT and telecom expo and conference, will take place May 9 to 11 at the Expo Center in Lahore. Over 1,500 leading global and local brands are participating in the event with more than 600 exhibition booths. The event will host more than 60,000 visitors from the tech sector, including foreign delegates from different countries.

articles.title: Top tech startup funding news for today, May 7, 2025
articles.author: Daniel Levi
articles.summary: It's May 7, 2025. NewLimit, a biotech startup co-founded by Brian Armstrong, secured a $130 million Series B round to develop therapies that extend human healthspan. OX Security, a cybersecurity startup providing an application security platform, raised $60 million to fuel its growth. Sett came out of stealth mode and raised $27 million to build AI agents for mobile game development. Blinq, a Melbourne, Australia-based startup offering a digital business card platform raised $25 million in a Series A round to accelerate its global growth. FoodHealth raised $7.5 million for its healthy food scoring platform.

articles.title: Education officials report threatening messages linked to PowerSchool breach
articles.author: Michael White
articles.summary: Staff at about 20 North Carolina public school agencies received threatening emails in connection with a data breach first reported early this year. Cybercriminals demanded payment in Bitcoin in exchange for data that was taken when the PowerSchool system was compromised. PowerSchool manages information for more than 1.5 million students and almost 100,000 teachers in the state's public and charter schools.

articles.title: Analysts see Bitcoin at $100,000 soon
articles.author: Nuntawun Polkuamdee
articles.summary: The FOMC interest rate decision this week could define the outlook for risk-on assets, including cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin rose 2.2% to $96,446 on Wednesday on higher risk appetite after the US and China said some trade dialogue is slated for later this week. Arizona recently approved two bills that would allow the state to invest up to 10% of its public funds into digital assets such as Bitcoin.

articles.title: Trump crypto advisor David Bailey launching $300 million bitcoin investment company
articles.author: MacKenzie Sigalos
articles.summary: David Bailey, CEO of BTC Inc., has raised $300 million to launch a publicly traded bitcoin investment company. The company is named Nakamoto, a tribute to the pseudonymous bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto. It will focus on acquiring and holding bitcoin and is set to merge with an existing Nasdaq-listed company. Its public listing is expected this summer.

articles.title: ChatGPT CEO Sam Altman launches dystopian eyeball-scanning 'orbs' across six major cities in the U.S.
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: ChatGPT CEO Sam Altman launches dystopian eyeball-scanning 'orbs' across six major cities in the U.S. on Thursday, May 1. The chrome-plated orbs scan the face and iris of a person for about 30 seconds to generate a unique "IrisCode." This code verifies that they are a real person who has not signed up before. The biometric data is linked to a World ID, a digital passport that Altman claims will allow for secure, anonymous verification online. The company claims the scans are deleted after processing and data is secure, but skeptics (like privacy advocate Glen Goodman) question potential misuse and hacking risks.

articles.title: Ethereum's price at risk – Why $1,815 support is key for ETH's next move
articles.summary: Ethereum shows bearish divergence and weakening demand despite a brief uptick to $1,832.73. A prominent whale has deposited the final 3,232 ETH worth $5.72 million into Kraken. The whale amassed 10,564 ETH for $21.78 million and later sold it for $29.49 million, making a profit of $7.6 million.

articles.title: Hyperliquid's bullish surge amid market uncertainty – HYPE gains 18%
articles.summary: Hyperliquid jumped to #3 in blockchain fees over 24 hours, surpassing ETH and Bitcoin. The native HYPE token has shown strength even in a risk-off macro environment that punishes speculative assets. HYPE traded at around $21.28 at press time, up more than 18% from its local bottom.

articles.title: Japan's Metaplanet goes all in on Bitcoin – Raises $25M after latest 555 BTC purchase
articles.summary: Japan's Metaplanet bought 555 Bitcoin worth $53.4M. Its total Bitcoin holdings now stand at 5,555 BTC, valued at $465M. It plans to expand into the U.S. with a $10M Treasury Corp in Miami.

articles.title: How the stablecoin economy skyrocketed to $240B – With Ethereum at its core
articles.summary: Ether's market cap has surged from $124k to $124.5 billion since January 2018. The network's total stablecoin supply is now a record $132.4 billion. Stablecoin market cap is expected to reach $2 trillion by 2030.

articles.title: Bitcoin Reserve law passed in New Hampshire: Will other states follow?
articles.summary: After Arizona rejected its Bitcoin reserve bill, New Hampshire advanced and enacted a similar bill into law. New Hampshire plans to diversify 5% of its reserve to BTC and other digital assets. The passed Bitcoin law will be effective by July 2025. Governor Kelly Ayotte hails the new law as the first in the nation.

articles.title: Bitcoin: 3,400 wallets dump BTC, but whales have other plans – Why?
articles.summary: Whale wallets scooped up 81,338 BTC as retail fled in panic. Bitcoin traded at $96,678.63, up 2.28% in the past 24 hours. Market watchers are now focused on $93,198. If it collapses, $83,444 becomes the next key level to watch.

articles.title: Billionaire fund manager eyes crypto fund in five years
articles.author: Anand Sinha
articles.summary: Tim Draper wants to have a fund focused entirely on crypto in the next five years. He wants to invest in Bitcoin and collect tax automatically. Draper is known for his investments in Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter. He predicts Bitcoin will hit $250,000 by the end of 2025.

articles.title: JARVIS reimagined: The rise of the intelligent wallet
articles.author: Ken Moore
articles.summary: By 2027, digital wallets are expected to account for half of all retail sales worldwide. They are becoming platforms for everything: verifying identity, storing loyalty cards, presenting boarding passes and rail tickets, accessing insurance documents, and roadside assistance memberships. In Belgium, 80% of people over 16 use itsme for secure identification, digital transactions, and electronic signatures. In the future, wallets could be semi-autonomous financial agents that analyze a user's cash flow, optimize investments, and negotiate loan rates.

articles.title: America's experiment in Democracy has Decayed into Kleptocracy-Rule by Thieves
articles.author: The Silver Academy
articles.summary: Donald Trump's presidency has devolved into a masterclass in self-enrichment. He used the powers of the presidency to manipulate markets, exploit followers, and rewrite the rules of political grift. Donald Trump's son, Donald Jr., has weaponized the 'executive branch' of the family grift to profit from advance knowledge of policy shifts. The $ Trump meme coin, launched days before Trump's second term, epitomizes this exploitation.

articles.title: Bitcoin Loans: Growing Price Stability – Archyde: Latest World News, Economy, Entertainment, Health, Technology & Sports Updates
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: As the cryptocurrency market matures, a new trend is emerging: Bitcoin-backed loans. These loans allow investors to leverage their Bitcoin holdings without selling them, unlocking liquidity for various needs. The increasing institutional involvement in the crypto space is driving the growth of the Bitcoin- backed loan market.

articles.title: Trump's crypto problem
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: Senate leadership is preparing to hold a vote on the GENIUS Act, which would create a regulatory framework for payment stablecoins. However, a contingent of crypto-friendly Democrats have threatened to vote it down, accusing Republicans of prematurely cutting off negotiations over the bipartisan bill. The showdown comes as the Trump family's growing portfolio of crypto projects fuel the legislation's opponents, who argue it will allow the president and his family to profit from the industry. Trump's close ties to the crypto industry have raised concerns since before he took office.

articles.title: Progressive Group Rebukes Democrats for Being 'Fully Complicit' in Industry-Backed Crypto Bill
articles.author: Eloise Goldsmith
articles.summary: The Senate is expected to hold a procedural vote on the GENIUS Act on Thursday. The bill would create a regulatory framework for a type of cryptocurrency called stablecoin. Our Revolution is a progressive political organizing group launched as a continuation of Sen. Bernie Sanders' 2016 presidential campaign. The group's executive director Joseph Geevarghese called the bill a "sham crafted by cryptocurrency giants that is certain to line the pockets of the Trump family's crypto empire."

articles.title: Bitwise Seeks SEC Approval to Launch Spot NEAR ETF
articles.author: Mallika Mitra

articles.title: Bitcoin ETF Inflows Top Gold ETF Inflows Year-To-Date
articles.author: Tyler Durden
articles.summary: Year-to-date, gold prices have dramatically outperformed those on bitcoin. However, the performance chasm has failed to deter investors putting new money to work. IBIT (BlackRock's spot bitcoin ETF) has surpassed inflows into GLD (SPDR Gold Trust ETF).

articles.title: Explosive Backlash, Xiaomi SU7 Owners Get Their Horsepower Back

articles.summary: Xiaomi's SU7 has been a runaway hit for the company, but some owners were disappointed following a software update. The update reduced the maximum amount of power from the car's tri-motor electric powertrain to about 888 horsepower. Xiaomi defended its actions to "muzzle" the SU7 Ultra's power levels from its owners, saying that the restrictions were made with safety in mind.

articles.title: How Trump family business ventures stand to directly benefit the President
articles.summary: Eric Lipton is an investigative reporter for The New York Times. Eric Lipton has written a series of articles about the president's conflicts of interest relating to his family's real estate and development companies and his cryptocurrency company, World Liberty Financial. Trump has urged Congress to pass the GENIUS Act, which would make it easier for U.S. companies to deal in a type of cryptocurrency known as stablecoin. After advocating for passage of the bill, the Trump family crypto company started issuing its own stablecoin and became one of the biggest issuers in the world.

President Trump announced Sunday night that the government would stop minting the one-cent coin to cut costs. Congressmembers last week revived a bipartisan bill that seeks to eliminate the penny.

Now the stolen data is being used to extort individual school districts across the U.S. and Canada, including 20 North Carolina school districts and the Department of Public Instruction.

articles.title: Markets reels after Fed says economy is 'in solid position'

articles.title: The First Crypto Currency: The Dollar
articles.author: Tyler Durden
articles.summary: Abraham Lincoln used interest bearing paper 'money' or 'greenbacks' to finance the Civil War and passed laws mandating the acceptance of paper currency as 'legal tender' for all debts. Paper money was seen as inferior to gold. The period of great economic growth and financial excess from the 1800s to the creation of the Federal Reserve System in 1913 was arguably as pure a private national banking model as ever existed in the United States.

He was quick to pause the tariff hikes on all countries except China for 90 days on April 9. The U.S. and China are finally meeting in Geneva on May 10.
